trial_identification.studytitle: Research study investigating the effect of a meal on hunger and blood measurements related to health
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Does pasta incorporated with sorghum flour induce lower post-meal glycemia, higher satiety and lower oxidative stress than control pasta without sorghum in healthy subjects?

interventions.interventions: Three types pasta products manufactured from either 100% durum wheat semolina or mixture of 70% durum wheat semolina and 30% red sorghum flour (red sorghum-containing pasta) and mixture of 70% durum wheat semolina and 30% white sorghum flour (white sorghum-containing pasta) will be used in this study. Each of the 30 subjects recruited for the study will consume each of the 3 pasta products once only. The pasta products will be presented as breakfast on 3 separate morning, 7-14 days apart in a randomised crossover design, after an overnight fast of 10-12 hours.
interventions.comparator: Control pasta made from 100% durum wheat semolina

primaryOutcome.outcome: Post-prandial glycemia by analysing capillary bloods samples by glucose meter (HemoCue 201)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At fasting and at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 min after pasta consumption

primaryOutcome.outcome: Plasma antioxidant capacity and plasma F2-isoprostane level (marker of oxidative stress) Microplate reader
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At fasting and 120 min after pasta consumption

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Perception of satiety using a 15 cm structured graphical scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At fasting and at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 150 and 180 min after pasta consumption

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy subjects Non-pregnant Not having sensitivity to gluten
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnancy Sensitivity to gluten History of cardiovascular disease Diabetes Medications know to affect study parameters

trial_design.sequence: Thirty healthy subjects recruited through advertisement in newspapers, flyers and personal contact, will attend 3 sessions to consume the 3 test meals. The test meals will be administered in a random order assigned by computer-generated random numbers concealed in opaque envelopes.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: School of Exercise and Nutrition Sciences, Deakin University

fundingsource.fundingname: School of Exercise and Nutrition Sciences, Deakin University

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: School of Public Health, Curtin University
othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress: Kent Street, Bentley, Perth, Western Australia. 6102.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This project will investigate the effect of pasta incorporating red and white sorghum flours on hunger, blood glucose and other blood measurements related to health.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Deakin University Human Research Ethics Committee (DUHREC)
